comments.body: I believe the exact opposite. As a builder we could use bamboo blocks as a decorative block that could give more character to builds in jungles or builds made from clay dirt or a nice flooring for hunter or desert stile builds

I have here to Agree its a cool idea i have so many Bamboo in my chests it should be bambo blocks/Stairs to build some cool houses/buildings there they should also a bamboo slingshot or something like a to trow darts or arrows with a bambo
What if you can orient bamboo blocks in different directions like logs
Bamboo block made of 9 bamboo that can smelt 4.25 items so you can store it more efficiently please.

Voted! Was searching before posting myself. Also, paper and bamboo doors and wall panels (thin like doors, but not openable) would be cool.

Similarly, stick blocks would be nice for storage and building.

Shouldn't we get both bamboo walls and bamboo fences? Bamboo has so much uses IRL but in minecraft it has none

Also two variants, dried and non dried, so we get both green stuff and brown stuff

If we are going for the look of a bamboo block, then green is not it.  Bamboo fades from green to a more lighter color which in the OP's case would make an excellent building block especially for asian themes
To be honset even if they add a bamboo block with texture bambo not binded by string and they add slabs and stairs that can have sideways bamboopices it wold be really good

My idea is that four pieces of bamboo can be made into a bamboo block. After that the bamboo blocks can be made into tools but instead of being like wooden tools, they mine faster and are stronger, and instead of using sticks in the recipe, more bamboo sticks in their place.

I was going to say something similar, however I feel like one block should be made of 9 bamboo planks, one bamboo plank can be placed like carpet-covering the whole block face, but can also be placed as walls. one bamboo plank would be crafted with 8 bamboo and one string, as both a pretty easy to obtain. the bamboo block can then be used as any other type of wooden plank.
I wish there was a bamboo door
Why isn’t there a forest slab

Love this idea and was just getting ready to try and make the same suggestion! There's really not enough blocks in the green pallet, and also there's basically no use for bamboo currently beyond smelting or making sticks. I'd LOVE to get to build with it

It's very weird that bamboo fences aren't in the game, given how easy bamboo is to lash together into fences in real life, and how iconic it is as a building material. It really feels like a missing or unfinished feature. In fact, the first time I encountered bamboo in-game, I even tried to craft it into a fence and was surprised when I couldn't.

Bamboo walls and bamboo slabs or trapdoors to use as flooring/roofing, or bamboo doors would be nice but aren't essential. But fences? It's so strange we can't make them already and would really help with jungle builds.

I do think a full-sized bamboo block might feel strange, as bamboo itself is so much thinner than a standard block. People have suggested bamboo bundles, but there is no similar block like bundles of sticks in the game. Or perhaps there could be a "bamboo basket".

I agree with this as well as the comments below that suggest two gradients, green and yellow/tan. 

Blocks could include the basic block, wall/fence, doors, and trap doors. I don't know if I would recommend slabs or stairs, but even without those, you could be looking at a potential of at least 4 new blocks with two different colors.
They could be made from 9 bamboo - cut into shapes - somewhat tube like - decoration and water transport.
Great idea! I'd also love if there could be Dried Bamboo Blocks that could be used in Jungle Villages, and made with smelted bamboo
Anyone else waiting for this to be tagged under announced after Minecraft live?
bro predicted the future
shouldnt be called a scythe tho... I'm sure there are better names!

Why shouldn't it be called a scythe?  Scythes are literally used to harvest wheat.  It doesn't make as much sense for the root crops, but eh...

And no, the hoe does not already do this.  It could be an added function to the hoe, but it's not a function we already have in an item.

However, you CAN use a fortune enchanted tool to harvest crops to get more from them.  Wheat only gives more seeds, though.  It also doesn't use tool durability, so it won't waste your Fortune III pickaxe.

Scythe would be good for a few things. I have a post about weopons and Combat if you want to check that out. In my opinion the Scythe should- Be crafted in the Smithing Table when it gets functionality

                             -Deal the same damage as the Sword with the Sweep of the Broad Sword

                             -Yield a higher amount of crop

                             -Reduce chance of harvesting poisonous potatoes

                             -And have the same range as the Long Sword

To understand this info check out my Combat Update V2 post thnx for reading :)

We have Pickaxes for Mining.

We have Axes for Chopping.

We have Shovels for Digging.

We have Hoes for Tilling.

We need Scythes for Harvesting!

 

Using a Scythe on fully-grown crops, gives you the item, and transforms the crop back to its first stage of growth, so you don't have to re-plant the crop.

Could come in a tool's typical varieties; wood, stone, iron, gold & diamond.

 

Could be used on:

Wheat

Sugar Cane

Bamboo

Netherwart

Ferns & Tall Ferns

Flowers & Tall Flowers

Grass & Tall Grass

Seagrass & Tall Seagrass

Lily Pads

Kelp

 

PS. You should also require a Hoe to harvest the root vegetable crops, such as; Potatos, Carrots & Beetroots.

 

PPS. You should also require shears to harvest crops that you have to 'cut' off their respective plant. Including; Melons, Pumpkins, Sweet Berries & Cocoa Pods.

 

PPPS. It doesn't make sense to be able to harvest crops with your bare hands, when you'd require a tool to do so in real life!
@johnoad If you think it shouldn't be that basic then I guess the regular sword should be called a Katana.

@Seb 103 

While I agree that the Hoe would make more sense, I still think it should be the Scythe. I feel this is like saying that you use an Axe for all the chopping trees, but you use a Sword for Acacia because it's different

I think instead of making an entirely new tool, they should probably just add this function to shears.

By this function I mean this...

The shears would harvest wheat without destroying the plant, and may give you a slightly higher chance of getting more wheat...

I don’t think it should go beyond Wheat...
Shouldn't be a used like a weapon or comparable to one, aside from that I'd agree with this suggestion. Tools should not be weapons.

I think the scythe should act like a normal hoe except it does more damage and can be used in place of a sword. The Scythe would have a higher chance of dropping heads and skulls. The scythe would be crafted with a hoe and another material of its kind.
When using a scythe the drops should automatically get pulled into your inventory, Including mob drops.
The scythe should have another variant, the combat scythe. that would keep it from being OP. Other than that, good idea.

383557987571 What about the Axe? It's a tool for wood based blocks and also a weapon that actually does more damage than swords, at the cost of charging time
for combat, I think it would be cool if it focused on speed, and sacrificed a lot of damage and knockback, maybe doing good at breaking shields and armor.

To flesh out this idea more:

  • The Scythe should be an upgrade to the Hoe.
  • It should retain all functions of a Hoe.
  • Crafted by combining a Sword and Hoe in an Anvil so the Hoe still has use early on.
  • The Scythe has a sweeping motion like the sword when left clicked.
  • When used on crops it "reaps" them.

When crops are reaped, it drops the crop yield and resets the seeds so you don't have to replant. It does this in a sweeping motion as stated earlier, making crop collection quick and easy.

Doubling as a weapon, it can make your suite of tools more useful and you don't necessarily have to carry a sword or axe on you at all times. You can "specialize" as a farmer this way.

I think scythes would be a great tool but should also be used as a weapon. Perhaps it could have the chains enchantment, as well as all the soul related enchantments from mc dungeons and be used to capture souls for artifacts.
Like the idea but i think the scythe wouldent use multiple things to do lik weapon, axe and hoe

Hey, Another idea for the Scythe:
realistically, If you break a crop with a scythe, the ones next to it will also break, As if you swung the long tool so that it reaches the ones next to to the crop you targeted.
What if the scythe can be thrown like a boomerang

While hoes are already used to farm, scythes can be their heavier variant with twice the amount of the crafting material. Scythes can harvest a lot more crops quicker and do more damage than a sword or axe. Scythes are also a little slower than axes.
It shouldn't have the ability to replant the seeds unless you add an enchantment possibly.
I voted for the scythe beacause it could become a really easy way to harvest crops but also be a great weapon.

Minecraft Scythe: Proposal.
==========
The Scythe Weapon & Tool: Longer Reach: Semi Fragile: Situational.
----------------
I do support the addition, as it could be implemented.
Ever cut grass, tall grass in real life, I have, and have used a few of these in my time. I see the need in Minecraft when cutting weeds, and clearing a large area. This tool could reach farther out, destroying things fast, and would also work on trees.

* Unique Damage: The Scythe deals the most amount of physical damage - but is situational, only used for certain scenarios, and only one equipped allowed.
* Healer: 1/8 chance to heal you or your opponent, 3–7 hearts, random.
* Freezer: 1/8 chance to freeze you or your opponent, random.
* Semi-fragile, with a 1/8 chance of breaking - causing unblocked self-inflicted damage, random 4–8 hearts, 1/3 chance of possible self-freeze.
 
Rare 99: an end-game item, exclusively sold through the Wondering Trader for "massive" Emerald Blocks (500-1000). This would balance the global market and give the WT a unique and very important role in the game (selling rares).  

Thank You
Good idea! I want a scythe for sweeping damage!

The Scythe could also work as a weapon, too!

The Scythe could do as much damage as a sharp iron sword but not deal any knockback. It could have an achievement that brings mobs closer called “hook.” and could also be enchanted with sweeping edge to attack multiple targets at once.

If made a weapon, this unique item could be added with a new boss or spawn occasionally with a 2% chance for a mob such as the stray or skeleton and would add interesting new mechanics to the game that would be useful for combat and mob farming.
A vertical iron handle. And recipe should be 6 glass blocks and 3 iron ingots. I wish I could post a picture here of what I have in mind.

I believe that glass doors should have a wooden perimeter around the edges. Maybe glass doors could be sliding doors!

I've had some ideas for this Concept myself!

First off I think there should be Glass Trapdoors as well, both of which would have all existing Tainted Glass variants.

Second, Wood Doors can be opened Manually or by Redstone. Iron Doors can only be opened by Redstone. Well, what's one of the unique traits of Glass? It's a "Transparent Block", and as such Redstone cannot be passed through it. So what if Glass doors could only be opened Manually?

Now frankly I don't know if that would be more useful or just obnoxious to people, but there is currently nothing with that functionality, so it could be cool to have.
Glass doors would be a useful addition because people would finally have doors that would fit more modern builds.
I’ve been saying this for years. Why are there no glass doors!? It would add so much visual appeal to glass walls instead of a wood or iron door that just looks completely out of place.
I think it would be fun if you can give the glass doors a colour by using stained glass

Definitely. It should be atleast 100 blocks range.
At the minimum, yes 100 blocks would be reasonable. I always thought that the range should depend on the type of material used. So it would make Make a beacon out of diamond or netherite useful.
More beacons on one pyramid could increase range, giving 25 more blocks per beacon. It's way less complicated than using different blocks to increase the distance.

Beacons need far more material to maximize the radius of their effects and have a far more difficult process of collecting components to build; i.e. collecting wither skeleton skulls at an egregious droprate (somewhat remedied with the nether update I believe), and then killing the wither boss to obtain the netherstar.

So I can see the upsides to this. It would certainly give decorators and landscapers more options for their builds. However, what I don't like is that it would add a whole bunch of new items with boring, derivative names like Plains Grass Block or Birch Forest Birch Leaves or Deep Ocean Water Bucket.

I like the goal of this idea, but my recommendation for you is to think more about exactly how this would work in practice. (Maybe you will find that this idea is practical for grass blocks, but not some of the others.) And I would recommend you invent names for the new items that aren't just listing the biome they come from. For example, instead of Desert Grass Block, use Dry Grass Block; instead of Tundra Grass Block, use Frozen Grass Block, etc.
Makes it to complicated.  Especially with the gradients between two biomes.
moss stone, mossy stone bricks and all that should match the grass colour for that biome too.

I have a suggestion for how that could be easily done with water. It's the same as for the new tropical fish. There are only one tropical fish mob and one bucket of tropical fish, but every one of them has an entity data called variant, storing the size, the pattern, the colour and the colour of the pattern.

So my suggestion is to add a colour entity data for water, it could be a simple RGB value generated from the biome. When you fill a bucket with that water, the value is kept in the bucket, so when you empty it, the new water source maintains its original colour. No need for new blocks, new names nor filling any creative tab with types of water!

This also gives me a cool idea that mapmakers would love: through commands, you could obtain a water bucket of any colour you want, so you could have some red-water representing blood (or a high-iron water), green for toxic waste and acid... If an alpha could be added to this RGB value, the possibilities would be endless: you could have an opaque black petroleum and also crystalline water.

Something similar could be done with leaves and grass, but then they will not stack in the inventory, and that doesn't sound great to me... Maybe a new enchantment like silk touch that also maintains the colour? I don't know.
how about a preservation enchantment on a bucket? so it keeps the exact colour of the water. also there should be options to change the RGB values and opacity for blocks, items,liquids e.t.c.
Maybe this could also be depending on the biomes temperature...
This makes so much sense dude!

I would absolutely love this if it also meant that in theory there's different grass types in the creative category since that would mean if you play creative you could replace the desert grass with for example plains grass if you so desired.

I play ion a creative realm with friends and not being able to change the grass colours in deserts is one of our biggest annoyances x'D
I agree with this idea. I think that we should also be able to use these new grass blocks in creative mode, too.

I had this same idea. It would be a great addition to Minecraft, especially when you are terraforming. For example, I like the way grass looks in the savanna biome, but when you put grass in the plains biome it just turns back to its usual bright green color. You could also be able to mix different grass blocks of slightly different shades to create more detail in the landscape, just like in real life.

You could also put a gradient in the block if it is placed directly next to another type of grass block, so you don't have that abrupt change of one texture to another.

You could also do a similar thing with the leaf blocks.

Swamp water would also be nice. If you scoop up a bucket of water from the swamp, then dump it in a different biome, it should be the same color. I hope you add this feature to the game in the future, Mojang. It would be amazing!

-PixelPig

I think it should be a data tag that can be changed via the debug stick.

(if you use commands, and you've never used the debug stick, then you aren't decorating to your full potential)
Biome specific water too

I'm kind of torn on this one because it feels so uncomfortably much like modded. Don't we have ice streams already to transport items across long distances? At the same time, it would be useful to transport items upward this easily, and less lag is always good.

Out of curiosity, what texture do you have in mind for this block? What behavior should be exhibited when you start connecting a bunch of lines of tubes into and out of each other?....

It is a little like modded, but at the same time it’s basically the exact same mechanic as hoppers, only specialized.  I don’t think you should be able to split a item pipe stream, just like you can’t really split a hopper stream.  You can have multiple feeding into one, but you can’t have one feeding into multiple.  At least not without doing a workaround like feeding it into a double chest and using two hoppers to pull out of it again.

I’m not sure what kind of texture would be ideal, but I imagine something that would merge well into the export end of a hopper and tile cleanly.

And if you think ice streams are the ideal way to transport items over distances, you obviously haven’t seen the moment when Mumbo Jumbo made a circle in Minecraft, Hermitcraft season 5. X3. He was AFKing at his pumpkin and melon farm, using water streams to transport the items to his storage system.  Except the ice line went out of his loading distance because his base is too big for its own good.  The items backed up where they went into unloaded chunks and he crashed the server when he went to find the problem.  Before the server crashed he saw so many item entities in one spot that they formed a circle.  He then ripped out all long distance ice lines and replaced them with hoppers.

All right, fine, you've convinced me. It does seem more limited and specialized than modded tubing, but useful. You've earned another vote.

I haven't seen that escapade of Mumbo's, sounds like he had a difficult time XD
Good point about the recipe.  I think using nuggets to help make the shape is a great idea.
Good, we need some non vanilla things in this game anyway.

transporting items upwards would be gorgeous - the dropper simply causes far too much lag.

One more thing, to really differentiate this block from hoppers: They would transport the complete stack, not only 1 piece from the stack. This way, they would transport MUCH faster and reduce current hopper-based-lag a LOT!

I love the ides of tubes/pipes, not only for all the technical stuff, but also the creative stuff - having some kind of horizontal pillar-/beam like structure would be amazing for a fair bit of my builds.

I think, this minecraft forum thread has a lot of great ideas of limiting pipes/tubes on a technical level.
https://www.minecraftforum.net/forums/minecraft-java-edition/suggestions/76128-simple-pipes-a-reasonable-balanced-alternative-to

For instance, the limit of 16 pipes/tubes after each hopper seems like a good way of preventing them from becoming OP.
This would be amazing and it would be far less laggy than water streams/hopper chains/dropper chains.

This would be a great addition. I'm not using THAT many hoppers in my farm but the Server is already laggings noticably. I have replaced them with water/ice streams where possible, but that does not really solve the problem.

People say this looks modded but Minecraft is always going to add something that probably already exist in mods but just different. I like the idea that it doesn’t pickup items but only transports them. Hoppers are also different because you have to place them right, pipes could be just added onto it without having to put it in the right direction.
I want this so I can transport items upward. So plz add it it would make redstone so much better. Though I do think it should be under redstone.

Pipes feels like a natural extension of hoppers and not modded at all. Minecraft sourly needs this and transporting items upwards with droppers or water just feels excessive. Same for transporting item horizontally with hoppers which they were not intended for shows the need for pipes. The mod "Faucets and Filters" have a great implementation of pipes that looks very vanilla.

One main use of copper is tubing, so why not use that to transport items three copper tubes for 6 copper lingot 3 on top and 3 on botton it will conect with hopper, depend the way u spot it is the way the item flow like A to B way and other type that could
Be A to B, C, way. and leave make the +64 hoppers

If they implement the perk/NBT data to increase the odds of being struck by lightning per each piece of Copper Armor you have as well as Copper items in your hand, that should also be implemented to Chain, Gold, and Iron Armor and Items, since all said metals are conductive.

 

However making Copper the tier inbetween stone and iron would break world templates generated in older versions of Minecraft. This would cause issues for map creators who use older generated worlds for world templates.

Nice idea! They could have a durability somewhere between 90 and 100, and they would be able to mine faster than iron and have higher attack speed because copper is a lighter metal in real life.

The only thing I don't agree with is the iron ore thing. I don't think they should do that to the stone pic instead I think instead it should be a tier between iron and diamond meaning you need a iron pickaxe to mine copper (currently it needs a stone pickaxe) and the copper armor and tools are better than iron tools and armor but not as good as diamond because wooden pickaxes and leather armor already fill the slot you proposed for copper I don't think the added risk of lighting strike would be worth it if it wasn't even as good as iron.

I don´t think they will ever add this idea, whowever I would like to see Bronze tools or armor made with Copper and other material. They would only be a little bit stronger than Iron but they would have more durability and echantability.

This is a good idea, but you should still be able to mine iron without copper.

I think that if putting copper simply as a tier between stone and iron would upset the balance, it could be made into a "maverick" tier of sorts, just like Gold. Gold mines the fastest of all the blocks, but is very soft. So Copper could for instance be a "gold-lite" of sorts - as soft as gold, but with mining speed say, somewhere between Iron and Diamond for example.

I also liked the idea of Bronze (or alternativrly brass if that tickles your fancy) - since it's an alloy that makes copper tougher, it could work as a more traditional tier between Stone and Iron. But that's probably overkill, the most important idea is to make copper not follow the standard curve just like gold doesn't.

I think it would be better if copper tools were between gold and iron, but you can still go from stone to iron without copper. I think it should be an item used to upgrade gold with. If you combined gold and copper you could make a bronze ingot, and if you combined a gold and a copper tool of the same type in a smithing table you could make a bronze tool. Bronze could have the advantage of being at least the same as iron, maybe abit stronger. It could have the advantage of being liked by piglins too, so it's stronger than gold but you won't be attacked by piglins.

I really like this idea with copper pickaxe, right now the game has almost no progression, you get iron in 3min and then go down to stripmine until you get diamond. This is just broken, and they should add copper in between stone and iron to slow things down. Copper should be in between stone and iron, you should no longer be able to use stone to mine iron and iron should get a lot more rarer and generate lower down.
it will never add copper tools becuse just like diamond and emereald

Great idea! I don’t think emerald tools should be a thing though. Emeralds already have a purpose, trading. Therefore I don’t think emerald tools should be a thing. But anyways, copper dosent have that much of a purpose so I think copper tools would be awesome and make copper more useful!

To be honest, Iron tools should be buffed durability wise, and Copper needs to be placed between Stone and Iron.  Basically make Iron roughly 500-600 Durability, and replace Iron's position with Copper, with Iron's old durability. 

Why? Because Iron is just not durable enough and making something between iron and stone would be just silly.  Stone breaks quickly, Copper tools would be pointless if they were between iron/stone durability wise without giving Iron a durability buff to begin with.   Cost wise using stone would still be better than copper as copper just wouldn't have enough durability to be worth it, Iron barely does already.

You could also introduce Bronze Armor, and make it in between Iron and Leather Armor Protection wise/durability wise.

Many Ideas have been posted here related to copper tools.  I just wanted my 2 cents added.  I would like to see copper tools because of how much copper seems to be generated in the worlds.  Having said that, If it would cause issues for creators (as noted in other comments in the forums) making them the same stats as Iron tools, but a different color would be enough for me.  Honestly, I am just looking for more recipes at the crafting screens.
Iron > Copper > Gold > Stone / Leather.

First and foremost we need copper tools and armour. Copper is almost useless at the moment, and copper tools that have a higher durability and faster mining speed than stone would be very useful, as well as realistic.

I don’t think it should replace stone as a tier. Stone should still be able to mine iron, but copper should just be an upgrade to be more efficient.

I see no reason why this should not be implemented as soon as possible.
Would love at least Shears to be able to be made from copper, it's so abundant and would make getting wool a lot easier.
It should be called bronze considering copper alone is a soft metal.

I see a lot of ppl saying it would “upset” the balance,however keep in mind,features don’t have to be op to be useful. It’s not as much about having something sought after for maximum power like diamond or netherite. It’s a middle ground for temporary use. Much like iron. I think it would be a good excuse as well to buff iron and possibly diamond gear. Maybe this is just a bedrock thing more so,but I find iron to be stupidly weak. It breaks far to quickly imo. Copper/bronze gear should take a few stat’s lower in defense than iron,but have the same durability. It would be a great mid tier platform.

No, I think instead, copper and iron should be equal. Copper and iron will likely have the same amount of value in the future, so it only makes sense to make their tool value be equal too. Plus, it would make mining faster, allowing players to mine at the same speed of an iron pickaxe without having to use a stone pickaxe constantly.

Hey! I love this idea and have some thoughts of my own to add to the discussion:

-Copper gear could "oxidize" as its durability got lower. It would change color and its stats would get better. For example, a freshly crafted copper sword does four damage points. Once it starts to oxidize, it does five, then six. This would create an incentive to use up the tools.

-In a thunderstorm, all copper gear would become "storm charged" and be even more powerful. A storm charged copper sword would have something similar to the channeling enchantment, summoning lightning to damage enemies. (As others have said, copper gear would also increase your chances of being struck by lightning. Risk and reward!)

Hope this gets implemented and gives y'all something to do with your copper stashes! :)
it will lose color based on duribility
It's end of 2024 and we still don't have copper tools & stuff.. :(

Instead of removing the ability to mine iron ore, make it so wood and stone tools don’t drop as much of it. Like maybe a 50% chance of dropping iron ore when mining it. Now copper has a purpose in the progression without adding essential complexity.
You like 1.21.9 dint you?
Yay copper tools!  Now make them interesting or distinctive.
Genius. Just... genius. I must support this immediately!

I think it would work like this: surround a piece of wool with 8 pieces of paper to make a Custom Banner Patern. Then take a banner with a pattern already on it and print the pattern. Then when using the new pattern in th loom it would bring up a menu with every step in making that pattern with empty slots that have the dye/item needed shaded in them. You can then decide to make the same banner or put in any different dye or pattern you want in any step. This would be awesome!
This would kind of ruin the fun of making overly complicated banner designs. Also, it feels like if they added this it would just replace all the banner designs they already have.

I would love this to be implemented! For train/subway systems this would be great.

On topic, maybe add directional detector rails as well.

This is a phenomenal idea, and one that Minecraft has needed for ages.

This is also by far the best implementation I’ve read for such a thing.

You can, I think, already accomplish this.  To nudge a stopped minecart just make sure it's stopped on a sloped power rail.  It will go down as soon as the rail is repowered.

For one way tracks you can just have small unconnected drops where the cart can't go the wrong way, or do something with sticky pistons to change the level.

Great idea

This can even be expanded upon with minecarts only being able to travel on the rail in its specified direction, stopping or reversing carts that hit it in the other direction depending if its powered. This will create truly one way rail roads.

This can create some interesting behaviours like putting two powered one way rails on either side of a track, pointing to the middle. This will make the cart within move continuously back and forth, bouncing against the one way rails, constantly switching the carts direction.
This would be SO USEFUL when making traps!!

wet when near water of any kind to prevent sand from falling on you when you dig underneath an ocean or lake.

would be great for timing mechanisms with redstone. Dries faster when exposed to sunlight, slower when darker.

funnily enough this is the exact same idea that i came up with, i guess there are other people in the world who are just like you. i had the idea of making the crafting recipe 8 blocks of sand with a water bucket in the middle, you would get the bucket back like in cake and it would give you 8 wet sand,

I think this is a fantastic addition that would make cauldrons more useful. Multiple ingredients could be used rather than just the generic items. For example, mushrooms and rabbit could be added to make a stew. The more ingredients could be more health points. If nutrition is added, the different ingredients could satisfy different needs

After the announcement of 1.20 for the next official minecraft update whom seems to be prioritizing self-expression, representation, and storytelling, I think this idea would help with players expressing themselves through their culture and gameplay understanding.

You know what's cool about cooking? It's everywhere, there's different methods to do it, and almost every culture on this planet has some form of aspect to it. Currently, minecraft has five different means to prepare food which is by a furnace to cook a stack, a smoker to cook a stack faster, shooting a flamed arrow to cook food instantly, crafting 3 or 4 items in a crafting bench to make something more grainy, and the most interesting one, a campfire which can cook up to 6 different things at once, if applicable. However, this new form of expression would make for a great addition to the game.

With the use of a caldroun, filled with either a bucket of water or milk, on top of a heat source like fire or lava, you can make your own soups! Add steak? Add carrots? Add mushrooms? Add potion effects by adding their respective potion? You name it!

Oh, and also make identical soups stackable like they did with buckets.
Try placing 4 trapdoors around a dirt block.
And these could be made with dyed terracotta or glazed terracotta!!

Besides the 2-block-tall plants, pumpkins and watermelons and tall cacti could be placed in them.
They could also have color variations, and an ordinary large pot could be a Gardener Villager workstation block.

Definitely need this. Tired of using a grass block with trapdoors in my house. Step on a pressure plate and its utter chaos! Color variants would be great too... Like the paintings, keep placing them till you get the color or style you want. Could do the same for the little ones!

Seems too op, I think that it should give you a fun potion effect instead like, the opposite of levitation.

I like the idea but it shouldn't have 12 armor points. In my survival world it's quite easy to get shulker shells so I think it would need to have a harder recipe like shells+ghast tears or eyes of ender. Other than that I really like the idea :thumbs up:
What about it has a unique effect, like when you get hit, it teleports you as if you ate a Chorus Fruit! Imagine the PVP implications!
They could look like different colors of a Netherite Helmet
Or maybe when you fall it grants 100% protection from fall damage but takes significant damage. It should provide equal protection to a diamond helmet.

With the addition of more and more passive mobs in the game, I'd like to see cages for pets. I like the idea of this working similar to the bucket for aquatic mobs. The cage could help transport small land mobs like the fox, cat, rabbits, chicken, parrot or even the bat!

It would be amazing if the cage could also have a displayed state, so rather than just releasing the animal after transport, the cage is placed with the mob inside. A pirate might have their parrot above their bed, a warlock might keep a bat above their study in the dim light or a farmer could be transporting chickens in the back of a wagon.

This has a lot of creative potential but also practical potential. Moving mobs to your base from their biome can be slow work, but a cage would help. It would be fun collecting all the colour variants. I know my main base is a long way from the snow biome so I was surprised to find white foxes and rabbits.

A chest surrounded by sticks and string would be a simple crafting recipe.
